info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 7:22PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN HAMILTON, NORTHERN CLERMONT AND SOUTHERN WARREN COUNTIES THROUGH 745 PM EDT... At 721 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Sixteen Mile Stand, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Mason, Lebanon, Norwood, Sharonville, Blue Ash, Loveland, Reading, Montgomery, Madeira, Milford, Deer Park, Mariemont, Williamsburg, Terrace Park, Morrow, Camp Dennison, Highpoint, Remington and Concorde Hills. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 9 and 27. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 10 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
